availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Kentucky native. Married Margaret Cook Crutcher on January 16, 1846 in Mercer County. Father of Thomas E. Crutcher, S. W. Crutcher, Peter P. Crutcher, Amanda Crutcher, Kate Crutcher, Bettie Crutcher, and Sarah Crutcher. Carpenter in Jessamine County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 42B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 752-753
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000191859, p. 726
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, page 20.
Find A Grave, "James P. Crutcher (1822-1888)," Memorial #35167849, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35167849 (accessed October 9, 2019).
